text: Thomas Frank Cassels ( 1845 – April 2, 1903) was an African-American who served as an attorney and Republican politician in Memphis, Tennessee, including serving a term in the Tennessee House of Representatives for the 42nd General Assembly (1881–1882)."Thomas F. Cassels," This Honorable Body: African American Legislators in 19th Century Tennessee. Tennessee State Library and Archives. ==References== Category:Members of the Tennessee House of Representatives Category:African-American state legislators in Tennessee Category:1840s births Category:1903 deaths Category:Tennessee lawyers Category:Tennessee Republicans Category:People from Jackson County, Ohio Category:People from Memphis, Tennessee Category:19th-century American politicians Category:African-American politicians during the Reconstruction Era
title: Thomas F. Cassels
